item.title: Weather Analysis
item.description: The setting I wanted to look at the weather this past winter and compare it to historical data. Luckily for me, there is an excellent publically available data source for historical weather data, provided by Environment Canada Snowfall Looking at previous snowfalls now. First you install all packages library("tidyverse") library("ggridges") library("viridis") library("lubridate") library("gganimate") library("gifski") Here is a picture of Skyfall:

item.title: First Post
item.description: Description This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
